required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CSD170501: Study to Assess Biomarkers of Tobacco Exposure in Smokers During In-Clinic Confinement Switch to an Electronic Cigarette
clinical_study.official_title: CSD170501: A Randomized, Controlled Study to Assess Biomarkers of Tobacco Exposure in Smokers During In-Clinic Confinement Switch to an Electronic Cigarette

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this clinical study is to evaluate changes in biomarkers of exposure (BOE) to tobacco smoke constituents after smokers switch from combustible cigarettes to use of one of the three electronic cigarettes or abstinence.

detailed_description.textblock: This will be a two-center, randomized, controlled, switching, open-label, parallel cohort study. The study will compare biomarkers of tobacco exposure from subjects at baseline levels of biomarkers of tobacco exposure after they have switched to one of three electronic cigarettes or abstinence for 5 days.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Biomarkers of Tobacco Exposure in Urine to Day 5
primary_outcome.description: A comparison of biomarkers of tobacco exposure in urine from subjects at baseline and for 5 days after they have switched to one of the electronic cigarette products or abstinence. Biomarkers of tobacco exposure in urine include: 4-(methylnitrosamino)-1-(3-pyridyl)-1-butanol) (NNAL) + glucuronides N'-nitrosonornicotine (NNN) + glucuronides 4-aminobiphenyl 1-aminonaphthalene 2-aminonaphthalene o-toluidine S-phenyl mercapturic acid (SPMA) 3-hydroxy-1-methylpropyl-mercapturic acid (HMPMA) 2-cyanoethyl mercapturic acid (CEMA) Monohydroxybutyl mercapturic acid (MHBMA) 3-hydroxypropyl mercapturic acid (HPMA) 3-hydroxy-benzo[a]pyrene

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Biomarkers of Tobacco Exposure in Blood to Day 5
primary_outcome.description: A comparison of biomarkers of tobacco exposure in blood from subjects at baseline and for 5 days after they have switched to one of the electronic cigarette products or abstinence. Biomarkers of tobacco exposure in blood include: 1. Carboxyhemoglobin

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Biomarkers of Tobacco Exposure in Urine to Day 5
secondary_outcome.description: A comparison of biomarkers of tobacco exposure in urine from subjects at baseline and for 5 days after they have switched to one of the electronic cigarette products or abstinence. Biomarkers of tobacco exposure in urine include: Unconjugated nicotine Unconjugated cotinine Unconjugated trans-3'-hydroxycotinine Nicotine-N-glucuronide Cotinine-N-glucuronide Trans-3'-hydroxycotinine-O-glucuronide

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Biomarkers of Tobacco Exposure in Blood to Day 5
secondary_outcome.description: A comparison of biomarkers of tobacco exposure in blood from subjects at baseline and for 5 days after they have switched to one of the electronic cigarette products or abstinence. Biomarkers of tobacco exposure in blood include: Plasma nicotine Plasma cotinine

arm_group.description: Subjects will use the electronic cigarette product (FT21039).
Subjects will use the electronic cigarette product (FT21092).
Subjects will use the electronic cigarette product (FT21018).
Subjects in the Abstinence Group will not be assigned any products.
